edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.layers

Class ImageParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.layers.ImageParameters

  • public class ImageParameters
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    Represents the image parameter options used when calling ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer.exportMapImage, Geoprocessor.getResultImage, and Geoprocessor.getResultImageLayer.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

      • getLayerDefinitions

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString getLayerDefinitions()
        Array of layer definition expressions that allows you to filter the features of individual layers in the exported map image. Layer definitions with semicolons or colons are supported if using a map service published using ArcGIS Server 10.
        Returns:
        JsArrayString

      • setLayerDefinition

        public final void setLayerDefinition(int index,

        Parameters:

      • getLayerIds

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger getLayerIds()
        A list of layer ID's, that represent which layers to include in the exported map. Use in combination with layerOption to specify how layer visiblity is handled.
        Returns:
        JsArrayInteger

      • setLayerIds

        public final void setLayerIds(int[] ids)
        Set the layerIds parameter.
        Parameters:
        ids - - A list of layer ID's, that represent which layers to include in the exported map. Use in combination with layerOption to specify how layer visiblity is handled.

      • getLayerTimeOptions

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<LayerTimeOptions> getLayerTimeOptions()
        Array of LayerTimeOptions objects that allow you to override how a layer is exported in reference to the map's time extent. There is one object per sub-layer.
        Returns:
        JsArray

      • addLayerTimeOptions

        option - - Array of LayerTimeOptions objects that allow you to override how a layer is exported in reference to the map's time extent. There is one object per sub-layer.
